H0.text: Electrical energy is the form of energy that causes a compass needle to point north.

H1.text: Heat is the form of energy that causes a compass needle to point north.

H2.text: Light is the form of energy that makes a compass needle point north.

H3.text: Magnetic energy is the form of energy that causes a compass needle to point north.

A4.text: The magnetic field exerts a torque on the needle, pulling the North end or pole of the needle approximately toward the Earth's North magnetic pole, and pulling the other toward the Earth's South magnetic pole.

A5.text: The magnetized needle at its heart aligns itself with the horizontal component of the Earth's magnetic field.
